resources.string: Only show floating ball when keyboard is visible
Please grant "Display over other apps" in system settings to enable the floating ball
Use floating ball for voice recognition

Some apps expose background placeholder text to Accessibility, which contaminates final insertion. When enabled, in target apps the floating ball switches to Select-All + Paste with an invisible marker to avoid placeholder issues. The clipboard may be used temporarily (best-effort restore). Works for Telegram, Douyin, etc.
Enter package or prefix (e.g., org.telegram). A trailing * means prefix match (e.g., org.telegram.*).
Copy recognition result to clipboard only

Applies only to the packages below: in these apps, when using floating voice input, copy the result to the clipboard instead of inserting via Accessibility APIs. If a line contains all, it applies globally.
Enter exact package names (e.g., com.tencent.mm). To apply globally, add a single line with all.
Please enable Accessibility Service in system settings to support this feature
Allow floating ball to insert ASR results into the current input field. No data is collected or uploaded.
Move mode enabled. Tap the ball to exit.
The floating ball will not be displayed. Voice recognition can only be accessed through the keyboard.
Enables the floating ball for voice recognition. You can use voice input from anywhere, even when the keyboard is hidden. Requires display overlay and accessibility permissions.
The floating ball remains visible even when the keyboard is hidden.
The floating ball is automatically hidden when the keyboard is hidden and shown when the keyboard appears. Requires accessibility permission to detect keyboard state.
Uses standard Accessibility API to insert text. Works for most apps.

For target apps, uses Select-All + Paste method to avoid background placeholder text contamination. The clipboard may be temporarily used (best-effort restore). Useful for apps like Telegram and Douyin.
Recognition results are inserted directly into the input field via Accessibility API.
For target packages, recognition results are copied to clipboard only, without automatic insertion. Useful for apps where direct insertion doesn\'t work properly.
